data.title: How to watch Olympic boxing at the Paris Olympics: : TV schedule, live streams, Peacock, NBC, start times, top athletes, preview
data.meta_description: Watch Olympic boxing live today at the 2024 Paris Olympics on NBC and Peacock, with full TV schedule and live streaming information plus info on top athletes and competition previews
data.text:
The complete boxing schedule, including TV listings, is also available on the NBCOlympics.com schedule page.

All live streams are also available to watch on mobile, tablet and connected TV devices via the Peacock, NBC and NBC Olympics apps.

You can watch every event at the 2024 Paris Olympics LIVE by subscribing to Peacock. After subscribing and logging in, either go to PeacockTV.com/Olympics in your web browser or download the Peacock app to your phone, tablet, or connected TV device and navigate to the Olympics section.

Users can also authenticate with their cable subscription, which allows them to watch live streams of every Olympic event on NBCOlympics.com, NBC.com, the NBC app or the NBC Olympics app. All streams can be viewed in your web browser or on your phone, tablet or connected TV device.

Live and tape-delayed coverage of boxing will be shown on the following TV channels: USA Network, CNBC

The full TV listings for boxing can be found on the NBCOlympics.com schedule page by clicking the toggle at the top to ‚ÄúTV Only.‚Äù

There will be 13 different weight classes (seven for men, six for women) contested at the Paris Olympics. The action will begin at the North Paris Arena before shifting to Roland-Garros, home of the French Open and the Olympic tennis competition, for the finals.

The U.S. men are seeking their first gold medal since 2004, while the U.S. women are in search of their first since 2016. This year the United States will bring a team of eight boxers, all rookies, to Paris. Names to know include featherweight boxer Jahmal Harvey, who won a world title in 2021 to end a 14-year drought for the U.S. men.
